The agents choose their desired subjective belief so as to maximize their utility, embedding the motivation, while minimizing the distance between their motivated belief and the objective one. As a result, it is never optimal to be Ã¢ÂÂtoo wrong.Ã¢ÂÂ Following Baillon et al.
